alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:25PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, south central Teton and west central Cascade Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1125 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Augusta to 22 miles northeast of Lincoln. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Bowmans Corner, Nilan Reservoir and Bean Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 102 and 123. Highway 287 between mile markers 16 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
